intro: Peucedanum megarrhizum, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers, which appear in late spring to early summer, are pale yellow to white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The root system of Peucedanum megarrhizum is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
